PPMonth.title: Back to the Future
PPMonth.notes: Thanks to the Chicago Puzzled Pint organizers for writing all of this month's puzzles!

puzzle.title: The Future is in Trouble
puzzle.hint: These Polaroids are from the past... [past Puzzled Pints](http://www.puzzledpint.com/puzzles/), to be exact!
The numbers tell you what to do with the Polaroids. What time-based information do you have about each photo?
Find the month when each photo was featured. Use the number to index into the month name and extract a letter!
"Restore the timeline" by placing the letters in chronological order (look at when the Puzzled Pint events happened).
The solution is: Mr. Fusion
Except for the cells with intersections, you must enter/exit each cell on exactly two sides. If you establish two of those, you can draw the track.
If you can eliminate one side of a cell containing a station, you know which two sides must be passed through.
You can't position track that will cause you to create a loop before entering every cell.
For an idea on how to begin the extraction, read the end of the flavortext.
The title is a clue.
Seas = Cs
Connect all the letters of ENCHANTMENT, which appear under all the Cs.
Start at the 10:00 position and move clockwise.
Find the letters in each of the 10 names that intersect with the C you just drew.
Read the intersected letters clockwise.

puzzle.title: Alt. 1985
puzzle.hint: Don't recognize anything in the trivia questions? Remember, things have really gotten mixed up.
The answers have gotten mixed up two, though a bit extra.
Some of the answers are more than one word.
Sample Hints for individual questions:
Geography (7):
The first two nicknames mentioned contain the word "City".
The city is in Illinois.
Entertainment (5):
The sisters' last name is Wilson.
Their other hits include Dreamboat Annie, Barracuda, and All I Want to Do is Make Love to You.
History (6,6):
The summit took place in Switzerland.
The answer to the question was an American, and the man he met with mentioned in the question was a Russian.
Art and Literature (5, 4):
The title of the movie mentioned is "A {blank} to a {blank}".
The series is a spy series.
Science and Nature (5):
One of the words of the first anagram is SOUTH
The answer relates to a feature of the Earth's atmosphere.
Sports and Leisure (9):
The athlete mentioned is a German with the initials B. B.
The sport is Tennis.
Almost every team in a division belongs to a category that spans all divisions.
Categories: Mythical creatures, Positions of leadership, Diseases, Units of measurement, Comic strip characters, Liquors, Cheeses, Weather systems, Arcade game characters.
Find the teams that donâ€™t fit into any category. There is one per division.
Use the W number as an index on the City name of those outlier teams, and the L number as an index on the Team name.
The 20 letters in order spell DISEASES NORTH TO SOUTH
The cities in order are: Calgary, Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Miami, Havana, Panama City, Quito, Cape Horn, Antarctic.
Look at the first letters of the team names from those 10 cities.

puzzle.title: Restore the Timeline (Meta Puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Each clue fits a word that was found in the previous 4 puzzles.
Locate that word in the grid. You may want to give the first letter of each one.
Place the grids in the appropriate part of the timeline

puzzle.title: Save the Clock Tower (Bonus Puzzle)
puzzle.hint: What part of a clock can translate to missing letters?
Bolts may have struck multiple letters at once.
Now that you have the numbers can they be used with the circled letters in some way? Does the flavor text hint at that?
